definition: lit. use others' strengths to make up for one's weak points (idiom from Mencius)/to use this in place of that/what you lose on the swings, you win on the roundabouts
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance
to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement
short/brief/to lack/weak point/fault

sentences.english: A:Therefore,I hope they could help each other and learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 所以我希望他俩能命相帮助，取长补短。

sentences.english: Exchanges with tourists, they found that their lack of each other.
sentences.chinese: 跟游客交流，发现自己的不足，取长补短。

sentences.english: Secondly, it is to help make up each other's deficiencies and improve subsistence capability.
sentences.chinese: 二是有利于取长补短，提高生存技能。

sentences.english: He expressed hope that Chinese and American filmmakers will be able to learn from each other.
sentences.chinese: 他希望中美电影制作人能够相互取长补短。

sentences.english: Is not blind obedience is each other, and accepting good advice.
sentences.chinese: 不盲从是取长补短，择善而从。

definition: good aspects/strong points
to foster strengths and avoid weaknesses (idiom)/to play to one's strengths
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)
complementary/to complement each other
incorporating diverse things (idiom)/eclectic/all-embracing
to complement one another (idiom)
when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to benefit from each other's strengths and make up each other's shortfalls/to reciprocate with material assistance/scratch each other's back
to choose the right course and follow it (idiom)
to master the subject via a comprehensive study of surrounding areas
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
shortcoming/defect/fault/one's weak points
to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to take the best/to absorb the essence
to remove the dross/to discard the dregs
collecting opinions is of wide benefit (idiom); to pool wisdom for mutual benefit/to profit from widespread suggestions
